From themes impertinent, the thick-scrall'd pane</br>At length a respite craves. — The jest obscene,</br>Acrostick's fulsome note, or slander's sting,</br>Alike I hate — detest — Be it my wish,</br>In grateful lines, justly to celebrate</br>A NORFOLK DUMPLING'S praise; — Belov'd repast!</br>With extasy I name thee!  Had thy bard</br>Poetic fancy equal to his appetite,</br>On Fame's high pinnacle thoud'st stand rever'd</br>For charms unequall'd!  Whilst the modern epicure,</br>Whose rav'nous maw threats ev'ry element</br>For food exotic, with depopulation,</br>Should linger as he read.  Not in the dish</br>Of far-fetch'd delicacies, such as grac'd</br>A loyal city's table, when presided</br>Britannia's darling Princes, could be found</br>A Gusto half so noble, half so fine,</br>As this, when from the bubbling cavern's mouth</br>Comes reeking, straight in dripping-pan immerg'd</br>From goose, or duck, or leg of pork produc'd,</br>The savoury show'r imbibes!  Oh, could I paint thee</br>In different vestments clad!  When at Meridian</br>Joan waits her faithful messmate, how thou'rt seen</br>Majestically rob'd!  Whilst round thy throne</br>Molosses rolls his salutary tide</br>Luxuriant! — Nor in estimation less</br>Art held, when wallowing in the golden flood</br>Of pease and bacon soup!....
—Here bait, my pen!</br>Lest like thy poet thou grow'st faint describing</br>What taste alone can prove! — Be Norfolk then</br>For Dumplings, Nogg, and Plenty ever fam'd!</br>
